medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain located in the right upper quadrant and epigastrium with occasional radiation to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 4-day history of intermittent abdominal pain, variable in intensity, associated with nausea, occurring independently of oral intake or body position. She reported profound fatigue and a significant weight loss of 13.6 kg (30 lbs) over the preceding months attributed to stress from her parents' divorce.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hereditary spherocytosis; underwent laparoscopic splenectomy and cholecystectomy 10 years prior for chronic hemolytic anemia with symptomatic gallstones.
medical_history.family_history: Hereditary spherocytosis in her mother and siblings.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for 4 years, drank alcohol sparingly, and was sexually active with one male partner, reporting no unprotected intercourse. Lives in a small town in New England and had not recently traveled outside the northeastern United States.
